--- title: Intro to Pyspark author: Scott Wied date: 11/03/2022 format: html: code-fold: false --- # Intro to Pyspark ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import numpy as np ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} from pyspark.sql import SparkSession spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` 22/11/03 16:02:24 WARN Utils: Your hostname, Pizza resolves to a loopback address: 127.0.1.1; using 192.168.4.216 instead (on interface wlo1) 22/11/03 16:02:24 WARN Utils: Set SPARK_LOCAL_IP if you need to bind to another address ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Using Spark's default log4j profile: org/apache/spark/log4j-defaults.properties Setting default log level to "WARN". To adjust logging level use sc.setLogLevel(newLevel). For SparkR, use setLogLevel(newLevel). 22/11/03 16:02:24 WARN NativeCodeLoader: Unable to load native-hadoop library for your platform... using builtin-java classes where applicable ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` 22/11/03 16:02:24 WARN Utils: Service 'SparkUI' could not bind on port 4040. Attempting port 4041. ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pyspark.sql.types as T import pyspark.sql.functions as F ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} pdf = pd.DataFrame({'x':[1,2,3], 'y':[5,6,7]}) pdf.to_csv('test.csv') pdf.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}
x y

``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} spark.sql("select 1+1").show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` +-------+ |(1 + 1)| +-------+ | 2| +-------+ ``` ::: ::: ###
